author: kdenhartog
content:
Sorry, should have scratched that once I figured it out myself. Here's where I made the PR: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6691

Main concern was that there were other EIPs referencing ISO specs (without linking them) which seems like a bad practice to encourage as well since it suggests readers still need to go pay for the spec even if it's not linked.

author: kdenhartog
content: E.g. EIP-1 references ISO here, https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1.md?plain=1#L145 (although this is self intuitive and slightly pedantic to say this requires some sort of change. I'm just doing it so we can set a precedent that we don't allow any links/references to ISO going forward)

author: samwilsn
content: Yeah, I think we can just drop the ISO mention there and go with `yyyy-mm-dd` ðŸ¤£

author: samwilsn
content: Not even sure what mentioning the standard gives us.
